fields.name: certificate_number
fields.title: Certificate Number
fields.description: Unique identifier by assigned by the RCA

fields.name: certificate_type
fields.title: Certificate Type
fields.description: In this case, all Certificate of Public Convenience & Necessity (CPCN)

fields.name: entity
fields.title: Entity
fields.description: The coded abbreviation for the company that operates the utility

fields.name: certificate_name
fields.title: Certificate Name
fields.description: The title of the certificate roughly corresponds to the utility

fields.name: utility_type
fields.title: Utility Type
fields.description: In this case, all electric, but other types could include cable, natural gas, sewer, and water.

fields.name: cpcn_url
fields.title: CPCN URL
fields.description: Link to the RCA webpage that describes the CPCN, including tabs for tariff matters and financial filings.

fields.name: entity_url
fields.title: Entity URL
fields.description: Link to the RCA webpage that displays the address and webpage of the operating entity and includes tabs for documents and pending matters.

name: rca_electric_certificates
title: RCA Electric Certificates
description:
List of Regulatory Commission of Alaska (RCA) Certificate of Public Convenience & Necessity (CPCN) numbers and entities. This list was downloaded from RCA search results and then parsed to expose the URLs leading to more information.

A certificate of public convenience and necessity is a legal document that grants permission to a company or individual to provide a certain service or operate in a certain area. It is issued by a regulatory agency, such as a state or federal government, and is based on the agency's determination that the service or operation is necessary and in the public interest.
